msgSnippet: failures are either due to exceptions thrown by your code or the exception thrown by the assert call itself.  Either way because of the exception the test

failures are either due to exceptions thrown by your
code or the exception thrown by the assert call
itself.  Either way because of the exception the test
method is exited at the point of the exception.  So no
the rest of the test is not executed.  In cases where
you need to do clean up work before exiting you should
have a try catch block around the test code and in the
catch block rethrow the exception.  You will also need
a finally block to perform your cleanup work.  See an
earlier posting of mine for some sample code.

--- Joseph Vaughan <jvaughan@...> wrote:
> What is the flow after a fail condition is reached
> in a test?
> 
> Does the rest of the test still execute? 
> Is the behavior the same for a failed assert() and
> an explicit fail()?
> 
> Thanks,
> joe
>
